title: He Wrote a Biting Post About Charlie Kirk. The Fury Came Fast.
summary: Residents of Palmetto Bay, Fla., have demanded the resignation of Councilman Stephen Cody, who wrote a post mocking Charlie Kirk’s support for gun rights.

title: Being a High-Profile Comedian Right Now Is No Joke
summary: With the suspension of Jimmy Kimmel on the heels of the cancellation of Stephen Colbert’s show, the landscape has unquestionably shifted for comics and hosts.

title: What to Know About Jimmy Kimmel’s Show Being Suspended
summary: Tension grew at ABC after Mr. Kimmel’s remarks about the Charlie Kirk killing angered conservatives.

title: U.S. Attorney Investigating Letitia James Resigns After Trump Seeks to Oust Him
summary: Erik S. Siebert had hit roadblocks investigating New York’s attorney general, Letitia James, and the former F.B.I. director James B. Comey.

title: Pentagon Introduces New Restrictions on Reporter Access
summary: The Department of Defense will force reporters to pledge not to gather or use any information that had not been formally authorized for release, or risk losing their credential to cover the military.

title: Some Europeans Fear Trump Aides Want a Far-Right Takeover
summary: The continent’s leaders have concerns that U.S. officials are pushing for parties that support their views of nationalism and traditional values to come into power.

title: Trump Says U.S. Military Attacked a Third Suspected Drug Boat, Killing Three
summary: It was the third time this month that the president said the United States had struck a vessel in the Caribbean Sea.

title: U.S. Is Losing Race to Return to Moon, Critics Say, Pointing at SpaceX
summary: The company’s Starship rocket, which has suffered a series of recent test explosions, is still years away from being ready for the mission, former NASA executives say.

title: Dozens of Nations Support France’s Mideast Peace Plan, but Not the Crucial Two
summary: The French president has rallied 142 nations behind a road map for a two-state solution after the Gaza war ends. Missing from the list: Israel and the United States.

title: What to Know About the Visa Standoff Between Trump and the United Nations
summary: The president of the Palestinian Authority won’t be able to attend the U.N. General Assembly after the Trump administration denied him a visa.

title: In Mexico, New Mothers Are Seeking Out Old Rituals
summary: Some women in the country’s capital are turning to midwives who they say offer a more holistic approach to care than hospitals usually provide.

title: Kennedy’s Vaccine Panel Votes to Limit Access to Covid Shots
summary: The panel recommended that people consult a health professional before receiving a Covid vaccine. Left unclear was whether Americans can still walk into pharmacies for shots.

title: How Poland Scrambled the NATO Jets to Shoot Down Russian Drones
summary: Western officials have concluded that the incursion was to probe their defenses.

title: Oil Sanctions Have Made Russia’s Shadow Fleet Swell
summary: Restrictions have made it costlier for Russia to ship oil by sea. But they have also expanded the illicit shipping economy, with lasting consequences.

title: Inspired by Conservative Tactics, an Obscure Group Seeks Sway for Democrats
summary: A liberal group that was spun off from a network funded by George Soros is looking to build off 2024 victories in Florida to help elect candidates to school boards and other local offices.

title: Hamburger Helper Sales Rise as Americans Try to Save on Food
summary: The price of beef and other grocery items are climbing, and consumers are turning to canned meats and a 1970s staple.

title: Robert Redford Was Everything You Hoped He’d Be
summary: Redford and Newman, real movie stars with real values.

title: ‘We’re in the Most Dangerous Point for Free Speech in America’
summary: Jimmy Kimmel’s removal looks more like a red scare than a culture clash.

title: Standing Date
summary: A weekly dinner party sounds so enticing, but establishing a ritual can be a challenge.

title: Trump Hails Progress on TikTok Deal After Call With Xi
summary: President Trump said he would meet with President Xi Jinping next month in South Korea. Mr. Xi said he welcomes a TikTok deal that would benefit both sides.

title: Cyberattack Slows Check-Ins and Threatens Delays at European Airports
summary: A disruption to check-in and boarding systems at airports in Berlin, Brussels and London threatened to snarl travel.

title: What U.S.-Korea Ties Mean on the 75th Anniversary of the Incheon Landing
summary: Incheon, the site of a crucial battle of the Korean War, has a singular place in South Korea’s modern history and in its ties with the United States.

title: Harvard’s Former President, Claudine Gay, Criticizes Its Approach to Trump
summary: Claudine Gay has rarely spoken out since she was forced to resign, but she recently said that Harvard should not cave to Trump administration demands, including a $500 million payment.
